016
017package com.github.siroshun09.mccommand.common.argument.parser;
018
019import com.github.siroshun09.mccommand.common.argument.Argument;
020import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
021import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
022
023import java.util.Optional;
024
025/**
026 * Parses an argument from a String
027 *
028 * @param <T> the value type
029 */
030@FunctionalInterface
031public interface ArgumentParser<T> {
032
033    /**
034     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Boolean}
035     */
036    ArgumentParser<Boolean> BOOLEAN = argument -> {
037        if (argument.get().equalsIgnoreCase("true")) {
038            return true;
039        }
040
041        if (argument.get().equalsIgnoreCase("false")) {
042            return false;
043        }
044
045        return null;
046    };
047
048    /**
049     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Short}
050     */
051    ArgumentParser<Short> SHORT = new ArgumentParser<>() {
052        @Override
053        public @Nullable Short parse(@NotNull Argument argument) {
054            try {
055                return Short.parseShort(argument.get());
056            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
057                return null;
058            }
059        }
060
061        @Override
062        public @NotNull Short parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
063            try {
064                return Short.parseShort(argument.get());
065            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
066                throw generateException(argument, e);
067            }
068        }
069    };
070
071    /**
072     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Integer}
073     */
074    ArgumentParser<Integer> INTEGER = new ArgumentParser<>() {
075        @Override
076        public @Nullable Integer parse(@NotNull Argument argument) {
077            try {
078                return Integer.parseInt(argument.get());
079            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
080                return null;
081            }
082        }
083
084        @Override
085        public @NotNull Integer parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
086            try {
087                return Integer.parseInt(argument.get());
088            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
089                throw generateException(argument, e);
090            }
091        }
092    };
093
094    /**
095     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Long}
096     */
097    ArgumentParser<Long> LONG = new ArgumentParser<>() {
098        @Override
099        public @Nullable Long parse(@NotNull Argument argument) {
100            try {
101                return Long.parseLong(argument.get());
102            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
103                return null;
104            }
105        }
106
107        @Override
108        public @NotNull Long parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
109            try {
110                return Long.parseLong(argument.get());
111            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
112                throw generateException(argument, e);
113            }
114        }
115    };
116
117    /**
118     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Float}
119     */
120    ArgumentParser<Float> FLOAT = new ArgumentParser<>() {
121        @Override
122        public @Nullable Float parse(@NotNull Argument argument) {
123            try {
124                return Float.parseFloat(argument.get());
125            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
126                return null;
127            }
128        }
129
130        @Override
131        public @NotNull Float parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
132            try {
133                return Float.parseFloat(argument.get());
134            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
135                throw generateException(argument, e);
136            }
137        }
138    };
139
140    /**
141     * An instance of {@link ArgumentParser} that parses an {@link Argument} to {@link Double}
142     */
143    ArgumentParser<Double> DOUBLE = new ArgumentParser<>() {
144        @Override
145        public @Nullable Double parse(@NotNull Argument argument) {
146            try {
147                return Double.parseDouble(argument.get());
148            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
149                return null;
150            }
151        }
152
153        @Override
154        @NotNull
155        public Double parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
156            try {
157                return Double.parseDouble(argument.get());
158            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
159                throw generateException(argument, e);
160            }
161        }
162    };
163
164    /**
165     * Parses an {@link Argument} to a specified type and returns it.
166     *
167     * @param argument the argument to be parsed
168     * @return the value to be parsed, or {@code null} if the parsing fails
169     */
170    @Nullable
171    T parse(@NotNull Argument argument);
172
173    /**
174     * Parses an {@link Argument} to a specified type and returns it.
175     *
176     * @param argument the argument to be parsed
177     * @return the {@link Optional} value
178     */
179    default Optional<T> parseOptional(@NotNull Argument argument) {
180        return Optional.ofNullable(parse(argument));
181    }
182
183    /**
184     * Parses an {@link Argument} to a specified type and returns it.
185     *
186     * @param argument the argument to be parsed
187     * @param def      the default value to be returned if the parsing fails
188     * @return the value to be parsed, or default value if the parsing fails
189     */
190    @NotNull
191    default T parseOrDefault(@NotNull Argument argument, @NotNull T def) {
192        T value = parse(argument);
193
194        return value != null ? value : def;
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Parses an {@link Argument} to a specified type and returns it.
199     * <p>
200     * Depending on the implementation, it is possible to use {@link IllegalArgumentException#getCause()}
201     * to get the exception that caused the conversion to fail.
202     *
203     * @param argument the argument to be parsed
204     * @return the value to be parsed, or {@code null} if the parsing fails
205     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the parsing fails
206     */
207    @NotNull
208    default T parseOrThrow(@NotNull Argument argument) throws IllegalArgumentException {
209        T value = parse(argument);
210
211        if (value != null) {
212            return value;
213        } else {
214            throw generateException(argument);
215        }
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Generates an exception that throws when the parsing fails.
220     *
221     * @param argument the argument that failed to be parsed
222     * @return the generated exception
223     */
224    default IllegalArgumentException generateException(@NotNull Argument argument) {
225        return generateException(argument, null);
226    }
227
228    /**
229     * Generates an exception that throws when the parsing fails.
230     *
231     * @param argument  the argument that failed to be parsed
232     * @param exception the exception that caused the parsing to fail
233     * @return the generated exception
234     */
235    default IllegalArgumentException generateException(@NotNull Argument argument, @Nullable Throwable exception) {
236        return new IllegalArgumentException(
237                "Could not parse argument '" + argument.get() + "' (index: " + argument.getIndex() + ")", exception
238        );
239    }
240}
